question_text: 26. The difference of temperature in a material can convert  heat  energy  into  electrical  energy.  To harvest the heat energy, the material should have conductivity conductivity conductivity conductivity

options.(1): low  thermal  conductivity  and  low  electrical
options.(2): high thermal conductivity and high electrical
options.(3): low thermal conductivity and high electrical
options.(4): high thermal conductivity and low electrical

solution: See-back effect Low thermal conductivity High electrical conductivity

Reason (R) : In isothermal process, PV = constant, while in adiabatic process PV = constant. Here  is the ratio of specific heats, P is the pressure and V is the volume of the ideal gas. In the light of the above statements, choose the correct answer from the options given below : correct explanation of (A) explanation of (A).

36. Given below are two statements. One is labelled as Assertion (A) and the other is labelled as Reason (R). Assertion (A) : A  B  C v A = 5  v B = 2  v C = 4 Three identical spheres of same mass undergo one dimensional motion as shown in figure with initial velocities v A = 5 m/s, v B = 2 m/s, v C = 4 m/s If we wait  sufficiently  long  for  elastic  collision  to happen, then v A = 4 m/s, v B = 2 m/s, v C = 5 m/s will be the final velocities. Reason  (R)  :  In  an  elastic  collision  between identical  masses,  two  objects  exchange  their velocities. In the light of the above statements, choose the correct answer from the options given below : correct explanation of (A) explanation of (A).
solution: In  elastic  collision  for  same  mass,  velocities interchange A  B  A  B V A = 5  V B = 2  V' A = 2  V' B = 5 Before collision  After collision B  C  B  C V' B = 5  V C = 4  V" B = 4  V' C = 5 Before collision  After collision V' A = 2m/s  V" B = 4m/s  V' C = 5m/s

question_text: 50. Two cars P and Q are moving on a road in the same  direction.  Acceleration  of  car  P  increases linearly with time whereas car Q moves with a constant acceleration. Both cars cross each other at time  t  =  0,  for  the  first  time.  The  maximum possible  number  of  crossing(s)  (including  the crossing at t = 0) is ________ .
solution: a P = kt, k is constant a Q = a, a is constant a Q/P = a Q – a P = a – kt as initial velocities are not mentioned in question, so will have to assume two cases. Case-I u Q/P and a Q/P in same direction u Q/P P Q a– Total number of crossing = 2 Case-II u Q/P and a Q/P in opposite direction u Q/P P Q  a–kt  Total number of crossing = 3

53. Given below are two statements : Statement  (I)  :  In  partition  chromatography, stationary phase is thin film of liquid present in the inert support. Statement  (II)  :  In  paper  chromatography,  the material of paper acts as a stationary phase. In the light of the above statements, choose the correct answer from the options given below :

options.(1): Both Statement I and Statement II are false
options.(2): Statement I is true but Statement II is false
options.(3): Both Statement I and Statement II are true
options.(4): Statement I is false but Statement II is true

solution: Statement I is true. In  partition  chromatography,  stationary  phase  is thin liquid film present in the inert support. Statement II is false. Because stationary phase in paper chromatography is water.

question_text: 54. Identify the essential amino acids from below : (A)Valine (B)Proline (C)Lysine (D)Threonine (E)Tyrosine Choose the correct answer from the options given below :
solution: Valine, Lysine and Threonine are essential amino acids.

question_text: 55. Which among the following halides will generate the  most  stable  carbocation  in  Nucleophillic substitution reaction ? Br Br Ph  Br Ph Ph
solution: Stability order of carbocation Ph   Ph Ph    >  >  > 

question_text: 56. Consider the equilibrium CO(g) + 3H 2(g)   CH 4(g) + H 2O(g) If the pressure applied over the system increases by two fold at constant temperature then (A) Concentration  of  reactants  and  products increases. (B)Equilibrium will shift in forward direction. (C)  Equilibrium  constant  increases  since concentration of products increases. (D) Equilibrium  constant  remains  unchanged  as concentration  of  reactants  and  products  remain same. Choose the correct answer from the options given below :

57. Given below are two statements : Statement (I) : NaCl is added to the ice at 0°C, present in the ice cream box to prevent the melting of ice cream. Statement (II) : On addition of NaCl to ice at 0°C, there is a depression in freezing point. In the light of the above statements, choose the correct answer from the options given below :

options.(1): Statement I  is false but Statement II is true
options.(2): Both Statement I  and Statement II are true
options.(3): Both Statement I  and Statement II are false
options.(4): Statement I  is true but Statement II is false

question_text: 58. Given below are two statements : Statement  (I)  :  On  nitration  of  m-xylene  with HNO 3,  H 2SO followed  by  oxidation,  4- 4 nitrobenzene-1, 3-dicarboxylic acid is obtained as the major product. Statement (II) : CH 3 group is o/p-directing while- NO 2 group is m-directing group. In the light of the above statements, choose the correct answer from the options given below :

options.(1): Both Statement I  and Statement II are false
options.(2): Statement I  is false but Statement II is true
options.(3): Both Statement I  and Statement II are true
options.(4): Statement I  is true but Statement II is false

solution: Statement-I CH CH 3 3 CH CH 3 3 HNO 3/H 2SO 4 NO 2 Oxidation  COOH COOH NO 2 (m-xylene)  Statement-II –CH 3 group is o/p directing while –NO 2 group is meta directing.

question_text: 67. Drug  X  becomes  ineffective  after  50% decomposition. The original concentration of drug in  a  bottle  was  16  mg/mL  which  becomes  4 mg/mL in 12 months. The expiry time of the drug in months is _____. Assume that the decomposition of the drug follows first order kinetics.

solution: 3 O  O CH 3  CH HBr  H S Br N2 OH +CH 3Br Phenol SECTION-B

question_text: 71. Consider the following low-spin complexes K 3[Co(NO 2) 6], K 4[Fe(CN) 6], K 3[Fe(CN) 6], Cu 2[Fe(CN) 6] and Zn 2[Fe(CN) 6]. The sum of the spin-only magnetic moment values of complexes having yellow colour is _______ B.M. (answer is nearest integer)
solution: Yellow coloured & low spin complex are K 3[Co(NO 2) 6] & K 4[Fe(CN) 6] (I) K 3[Co(NO 2) 6] Co+3  [Ar]3d6 In presence of ligand field  [Ar] 3d  4s  4p d2sp3 hybridisation Magnetic moment =  n(n  2) BM = 0 BM (II) K 4[Fe(CN) 6] Fe+2  [Ar]3d6 In presence of ligand field  [Ar] 3d  4s  4p d2sp3 hybridisation Magnetic moment =  n(n  2) BM = 0 BM

question_text: 73. In  the  Claisen-Schmidt  reaction  to  prepare, dibenzalacetone from 5.3 g benzaldehyde, a total of 3.51 g of product was obtained. The percentage yield in this reaction was ______ %.
5.3 gm  O + Benzaldehyde  Ph  Ph Dibenzalacetone (Product)
3.51 gm  (Actual) O Theoretical =  Mol 1 40 % yield = 0.015  100  60% 1/40
